intro: Racosperma burbidgeae, commonly known as the Burridge's acacia, is a flowering plant native to Australia. It belongs to the Fabaceae family, which is characterized by its pod fruits and nitrogen-fixing abilities. The plant is a small shrub with bipinnate leaves and yellow flowers that bloom in spring. It is adapted to arid environments and is often found in sandy soils. Racosperma burbidgeae is of interest to botanists due to its unique morphology and ecological significance in its native habitat.
